titleStmt.title: Receipt for salt, wool(?), and income of a server taxes

msItemStruct.note: Catalogue no. 20; Nelson collection no. N275. 1/3 silver (kite) 1 1/4 (ob.) equals 5 1/4 obols, presumably 1 1/2 obols for the salt tax at the normal female C rate, introduced in year 5 of Ptolemy III, and 3 3/4 obols for the wool tax. The scribes Petechonsis (son of Psenthotes) and Osoroeris, son of Horos are also attested together on O. Leiden AES 30 (Nur el-Din 1974), a receipt for salt and wool taxes dated to year 5 by the editor, but which Muhs prefers to date to year 15. 1/2 silver kite 1 3/4 (ob.) is 7 3/4 obols, presumably 4 obols for the salt tax at the normal male C rate, introduced in year 5 of Ptolemy III, and 3 3/4 obols for the income of a server tax.

layout.ab: Source of description: On recto: receipt

handDesc.p: Line 7 is written in a different hand. Muhs relates that the second sign of the year date in line 6 could easily be read sp instead of 10, making the year 7 rather than 17.
